page.title: 09Uncle Harry Remembers.
page.content: I interviewed my{Uncle Harry}and{ {Auntie Ev.}about life in the 1940's. The money then was pounds,shillings and pence.A bicycle, for example, was Â£4-10s-0d. Uncle Harry started work at 14 years old, he was paid 2s 2d a day for working down the pit. The houses built down our street were built by the{NCB,}and were built in{1917.}Only miners from{Dearne Valley}could live in them.Cars in those days used to cost Â£60-0s-0d and petrol 2d or 3d. Uncle Harry said that bananas were seven for a tanner,and he would take bread and dripping for his dinner down the pit. He used to work at{Dearne {Valley Pit,}which is very close to Great Houghton.Sally's shop used to be owned by Liza Pearson.When my Uncle and Aunty first went to live in their house their rent was 6 bob a week.
